Articles.Content:
One of the common ones is 'Mini-mus'

Anyone here have an origin worth posting?
I think it was supposed to be Mini-Mun (miniature Mun) but either the devs thought it was too unoriginal or made a typo and it ended up as Mini-Mus

I think it was supposed to be Mini-Mun (miniature Mun) but either the devs thought it was too unoriginal or made a typo and it ended up as Mini-Mus

Which was then shortened to Minmus to point out unobservant people allowing others to make fun of them.
Little mouse? In reference to the faint cometary tail it develops on closest approach to Kerbol?
I reckon Minmus sounds like Mimas. Therefore, Minmus is probably the moon of a gas giant that had enough momentum to escape into solar orbit, and got captured by Kerbin.

Well, the word minimus means smallest of a series. Since Minmus would almost have to be the smallest visible object in the Kerbol system, and if we contract the i a little bit, obviously, it\'s about a female cartoon mouse.

I\'m no good at Etymology, but if I had to guess how the name came about I\'d say someone said Min for a laugh, wasn\'t it NovaSilisko who came up with the name Mun?

Though how you\'d get from Min to Minmus I don\'t know, so I\'m most certainly incorrect.
I have to wonder if there\'s any connection to Minimoose. Particularly the part where it was there the entire time, really.
